X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281

I like this idea of adding a new optional gzip 'extra' header field that 
has in it the length of the compressed member (Yes, ARCReader could 
exploit such a field if present; it does its own parse of gzip header 
now).  

To avoid an extra copy during the writing of the gzipped ARC, the writer 
might instead backup and fill in the compressed length after gzipping 
had finished.  Would need to profile to make sure this extra I/O didn't 
come at some outlandish cost (General tendency should be toward 
minimizing crawl-time I/O).

I added your suggestion for consideration as part of ARC file revision 
proposal: http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?ArcRevisionProposal.

Good man Tom,
St.Ack

FYI: The IA header is written in the first record only, not on 
subsequent members.



Tom Emerson wrote:

>Heritrix created GZIP members include an extra header field in the
>GZIP header indicating that they were created by the IA.
>
>What if the header field was expanded, or a new one added, that
>included the length of the *compressed* record.
>
>This could be done if the compression is done before the header is
>written. At that point we would know the size of the full member
>(header + compressed data + footer) and could plop this into the
>header, then write the whole thing to the file.
>
>A reader skips extra headers it doesn't understand. A reader that
>knows about the header could take advantage of it.
>
>I don't know if the Heritrix architecture (or the Java binding the
>zlib) would allow this, but it may be worth thinking about.
>
>    -tree
>
>  
>
